review_blob: Pours a subtly faint yellow from the bottle while forming a decent head on top that will linger for a bit.  The nose provides hints of lemony citrus and some sourness to it.  Very sparkling and complex, great for those that like Belgium style ales and saisons.  Not bad, just not my thing

Pours out in a hazy colourful orange liquid that is capped with a hearty yet fluffy head on top that lasts.  Lots of hoppy floral aromas to be had with a good bit of citrus in there as well.  Almost a fruity flavour, citrus fruit.  Gives a good amount of bitterness with the citrus to create a great beer well worth the hunt to find.

Poured from a can to show a light orangey look about it.  Created a nice frothy head on top that lasted for most of the beer leaving that wonderful lacing all the way down.  The smell of the hops hit early, but not overpowering.  There are a lot of hops and bitterness, but it all really works well.  Get a lot of sweetness mixed in with the bitterness to really create a well balanced and enjoyable IPA that will let you take down a few at a time and not have your taste buds burnt off for doing so

Well balanced beer that pours a nice color from the bottle and presents a great head on top.  A good blend of the three hops used that give a pine taste without overwhelming.  Very smooth, almost dry on the finish.  A great IPA!

What you see is what you get in this chille infused beer.  The nose starts things off with a  fresh whiff of the chille spice that is about to hit your tastebuds.  Poured a hazy orange color with a thin head on it, it burns up just as fast as your taste buds are sure to.  They are not lying when they say that this one brings the heat!  Prepare to drink liquid fire with a touch of alcohol behind it.

Comes out a light colored amber.  Very pale.  What you see is what you get when it comes to this lager, nothing special, nothing horrible.  A decent beer that can be refreshing but not going to blow your socks off.

Comes out of the bottle in a very nice amber color with a whiteish head on top.  Has the smell and taste of hops that we all know and love.  Good tasting and linguring finish make this a great pale ale to try.
Pours a dark brown/black color that forms and off white to light brownish head on top.  Smells of some roasted maltyness with a definite after aroma of booze!
Pours a very dark  coor, almost black, out of the bottle.  Mild maltyness to it with some hop character to it.  Powerful taste that lingers for some bit.  Lets you know you are drinking a beer.

Fills up the glass in an ambery gold color witt an almost white head on top.  Comes off like you think an IPA should with a tad bit more malt.  Very piney notes in the aroma and plenty of hops to be enjoyed by all.

On draft from the brewery.  Pours a clear dark brown that gives rise to a frothy brown head on top that lasts for the length of the beer.  Good malty beer with signs of chocolate in it to smooth it out.  Very smooth and low carbonation make it a pleasure to enjoy.   Check out the boys at Country Boy!

Starts with a nice amber pour that forms a decent head and leaves moderate lacing down the glass.  A medium bodied beer that has some roasted malty tones and a little caramel as well.  Good balance to it.
A cloudy hazey dark amber color with a very pronounced head on top.  Good bitterness in the finish as it seems to linger on the tongue for some time.
beer_name: Rock Bottom College Park American Red Ale

review_blob: A nice hint of rye in there with a bitter finish.  Pours an amber in color with little head but leaves a good trace of lacing down the glass as you drink.
beer_name: Rock Bottom Indianapolis (College Park) Rye IPA

review_blob: A strong nose of blueberries let you know what you are in for before even putting this beer to your tastebuds.  A refreshing beer with the taste of fresh blueberries makes you love this beer on a hot day.

Pours from the bottle a nice coppery color with a nice tan head on top.  Has a sweet aroma and a rich malt flavor hinted by some citrusy notes.  Picks up some great notes from the citra hops.  A great pale ale to try!
Starts with floraly hints in the aroma, but not in the flavor.  Finishes with a nice clean palate pleasing taste.
This beer is set out to ruin your taste buds and with that comes some delicious tasting beverage if you are hopped up enough to handle it.
This is one of the best IPAs out there.  Has plenty of hops to satisfy and hop head without completly overpowering and ruining the beer.
Poured a nice amber color with a whit frothy head on top.  The rye and hops are mixed well where neither seems to overpower the other.  Great time at the brewery and lots of fun in the tasting room.
Had it on tap from the brewery in Nashville.  Pretty tasty with hints of maple syrup that adds a nice sweet finish.
Pours an orangey dark brown with a frothy white head on top.  Has a coppery aftertaste.  A decent beer, not my favorite in the brown ale catagory but a decent offering from a smaller brewery.

Pours a clear golden with a very nice white head on top with the wonderful aromas of hops and citrus.  The hops provide that much sought after aroma and taste here.  One of the best IPAs I have had.  So flavourful and also very sessionable at the same time so you can make sure to enjoy several of these fantastic Lagunitas beers.

Pours light as your typical commodity US beer does.  Very carbonated living up to the champpagne side of the title, but not on the classy element.  No hop bitterness or much of a mouth feel to enjoy here.  You should take a hint by the fact that the picture for high life is a 40oz...
UPDATED: MAR 7, 2013

Pours a dark clear liquid with a good sense of malt and grains.  Not a bad finish, be careful when drinking out of the liter steins as they go down smooth and quick without the drinker realizing how much they have downed.  A good beer and place to grab some unique brews.

This beer pours a nice straw like yellow with a bit of hops and grains in the aroma.  Has a subtle honey flavor as well.  Had it on tap at the brewery.  A great time and a great place to visit, enjoy some beers, and talk to the brewers who are more than willing to lend an ear on all things beer.

You may feel like you need a fork and knife at times for this fantastic stout, but it is one heck of a good drink.  Try it out and enjoy the strong coffee notes that really set this beer apart.  It has a strong but smooth coffee offering as well as the sweet cinnamin that comes to the nose.  Enjoy this for breakfast, lunch, and dinner

There is almost too much going on here.  There are many subtle hints of malt, barley, various hops, and the list goes on and on.  You get a little bit of a lot, but for me it fails to pull it all together.  It is still a decent one off brew, but I was hopping for more when it came to this collaboration.
What is to say about fratty light than it is what it is.  A simple watered down brew designed for those looking to go for quanity and not quality.
My goodnes my guinness.  As always it comes old smooth and creamy with a good hint of the malt.  A creamy head forms on top to create a great lid to the liquid.

This is something different being a coffee bourbon barrel stout.  Unlike other bourbon barrel aged beers I have had, this one picks up a slight amount of bourbon flavour, but this one is more steered to the coffee flavor.  A smooth finish with the aroma and taste of coffee give this stout something different.  The color is nice and dark and pours with a nice head formed on top.  Almost want to add a drop of cream to this delicious stout.
I good IPA from a small brewery.  There is plenty of hops here, but missing some of the citrusy hints that come along with many IPAss.
It pours a little less than what I expected from an amber ale, but finishes with a smooth taste.  Not a bad brew from a small and local brewery.  Would try again.

An interesting selection that proved that beers can take you on a wild and wonderful journey of taste in ways that you may have never thought of before.  A subtle hint of cherry in this dark stout is sure to please the pallate.
beer_name: Bells Cherry Stout - Bourbon Barrel Aged

review_blob: Get ready for the yeti as this beer packs a punch and takes no prisoners.  Well blended with the berrel aging and at 12..5% abv there is no wondering why people watch out for the yeti.
beer_name: Great Divide Yeti Imperial Stout - Barrel Aged

review_blob: A super delicious brew that combines all of the beer lovers favorites in one hoppy elixer.  Hopslam is a seasonal limited release and it is well worth it if you can get your hands on some, many places limit how much you can buy at once it can be so limited at times.  Get out there and get slammed by Bells!

A unique brew that combines a smooth ale with the flavor and alcohol of Kentucky bourbon.  I highly enjoy the regular Kentucky Ale as well.  With an ABV of over 8% it packs a whallop and is perfect for dinner or exchanging wine for a fine craft brew.
